section.section: Unless a juvenile court gives legal custody to another person, a child's guardian under this subtitle has legal custody.

Unless a juvenile court orders otherwise and subject to review by the juvenile court, a child's guardian may make all decisions affecting the child's education, health, and welfare, including consenting:

A local department shall notify a juvenile court, a child's attorney, and the attorney for each other party who has not waived the right to notice:
within 2 business days after the child's placement changes or the time required under § 5-326(b) of this subtitle, whichever is shorter;
within 2 business days after the child is placed in a psychiatric facility; or
within 2 business days after the child is absent from a placement for more than a week.
A local department shall give a child's attorney the child's new address and telephone number within 2 business days after the address or telephone number changes.
